page.title: 10EMPLOYMENT IN BOURNE
page.content: Ninety children were asked about their{fathers' jobs}and we found that the two most popular jobs were builders and lorry drivers.Next came carpenters,mechanics,farmers and farm workers and local services like ambulance drivers and policemen. {In June 1985, 500 people were out of {work}in the Bourne area.This is partly because of the increased number of machines used on the farms and partly because firms in Bourne and the surrounding towns have closed down or decreased output owing to the recession.Although so many people were out of work, the average amount of pocket money was Â£1 per week. To help ease unemployment,Bourne has an{industrial}area,which is steadily growing,to the east of the town.The area includes a brewery,carpentry firm and a farm machinery assembly company.
